0.text: Programming isn't about what you know; it's about what you can figure out.
0.author: Chris Pine

1.text: The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it.
1.author: Dennis Ritchie

2.text: Sometimes it's better to leave something alone, to pause, and that's very true of programming.
2.author: Joyce Wheeler

3.text: In some ways, programming is like painting. You start with a blank canvas and certain basic raw materials. You use a combination of science, art, and craft to determine what to do with them.
3.author: Andrew Hunt

4.text: Testing leads to failure, and failure leads to understanding.
4.author: Burt Rutan

5.text: The best error message is the one that never shows up.
5.author: Thomas Fuchs

6.text: The most damaging phrase in the language is.. it's always been done this way
6.author: Grace Hopper

7.text: Don't write better error messages, write code that doesn't need them.
7.author: Jason C. McDonald

8.text: Me and pride made a pact.
8.author: NF

9.text: Maybe someday I can learn to be happy.
9.author: NF

10.text: My biggest failure in life is knowing that I never tried.
10.author: NF

11.text: A lot of people know me, but they don’t know me well.
11.author: NF

12.text: It’s hard to be clean when you play in the dirt.
12.author: NF

13.text: Make you cry makes me feel like a bad person.
13.author: NF

15.text: I want to know what it’s like to sit down with my friends and feel like they might understand me.
15.author: NF

16.text: I just need some time, I’m tryna think straight. I just need a moment in my own space. Ask me how I’m doin’, I’ll say “okay, ” yeah. But ain’t that what we all say?”
16.author: NF

17.text: It’s easy to blame God but harder to fix things.
17.author: NF

18.text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
18.author: Nelson Mandela

19.text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
19.author: Walt Disney

20.text: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life. Don't be trapped by dogma – which is living with the results of other people's thinking.
20.author: Steve Jobs

21.text: If life were predictable it would cease to be life, and be without flavor.
21.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

22.text: If you look at what you have in life, you'll always have more. If you look at what you don't have in life, you'll never have enough.
22.author: Oprah Winfrey

23.text: If you set your goals ridiculously high and it's a failure, you will fail above everyone else's success.
23.author: James Cameron

24.text: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
24.author: John Lennon

25.text: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
25.author: Benjamin Franklin

26.text: Whoever is happy will make others happy too.
26.author: Anne Frank

27.text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
27.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

29.text: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
29.author: Abraham Lincoln

30.text: Life is never fair, and perhaps it is a good thing for most of us that it is not.
30.author: Oscar Wilde

31.text: All great changes are preceded by chaos.
31.author: Deepak Chopra

32.text: Change alone is eternal, perpetual, immortal.
32.author: Arthur Shopenhauer

34.text: Change is inevitable. Growth is optional.
34.author: John C. Maxwell

35.text: Change your thinking, change your life.
35.author: Ernest Holmes

36.text: Failure is not fatal, but failure to change might be.
36.author: John Wooden
